column5: Evidentely they hit another road side  bomb today..........

Dang that realy sucks. we are just out the door to go visit my friend who is on a 3 week leave from there he will be heading back over again monday to finish his tour. RIP to thoes we lost and thanks to all the serve us we can never pay them back enough

Another tough loss for all Canadians. Most of them so close to the end of there tour at the end of the month. It's a new kind of war and tough one to win or control.  My Condolances go out to all the families.
Very unfortunate indeed.  Maybe they should stay off the beaten path.  I feel for the families tonight and wonder when this is going to stop.  Joey

dont take this the wrong way  yes it is tragic that more young canadians had to die  but the stat right now is for every solider killed there are 3 mamed or disable for the rest of their life, no arms /legs/sight /paralyzed  take a trip down to sunnybrook hospital and go to the veterans wing, you will be shocked and there are no reporters or television cameras there they will not show you that cause it is to gruesome and shocking death is clean on t.v. and in the papers  when I was there some of the soliders wished that had made the ultimate sacrifice rather than living in years of pain
VERY SAD INDEED!!!!!! My thoughts and sympathy go out to their families    I hope they find and vapourize the the individuals resposible for this
Sad, sad day. May these brave men rest in peace and deepest condolences to the families.  Sincerely, Jim
